content.text: Bash mv Command - Move or Rename Files
Using the mv Command
The mv command is used to move or rename files and directories.
content.html: The mv command is used to move or rename files and directories.

content.text: It's like changing where a file is or what it's called.
content.html: It's like changing where a file is or what it's called.

content.text: Basic Usage
To move a file, use mv source_file destination_directory :
content.html: To move a file, use mv source_file destination_directory:

content.code_html: mv my_file.txt /path/to/destination/

content.text: Renaming Files
To rename a file, use mv old_name new_name :
content.html: To rename a file, use mv old_name new_name:

content.code_html: mv old_name.txt new_name.txt

content.text: Options Overview
The mv command has several options to customize its behavior:
content.html: The mv command has several options to customize its behavior:

content.text: -i Option: Prompt Before Overwrite
The -i option will prompt you before overwriting files, helping you avoid accidental replacements.
content.html: The -i option will prompt you before overwriting files, helping you avoid accidental replacements.

content.code_html:
mv -i my_file.txt myfolder/
mv: overwrite 'myfolder/my_file.txt'?

content.text: -u Option: Move Only Newer Files
The -u option moves files only if the source file is newer than the destination file.
content.html: The -u option moves files only if the source file is newer than the destination file.

content.code_html: mv -u new_file.txt /path/to/destination/

content.text: -v Option: Verbose Mode
The -v option enables verbose mode, which displays the files being moved in the terminal.
content.html: The -v option enables verbose mode, which displays the files being moved in the terminal.

content.text: This is useful for tracking the move process, especially when dealing with many files.
content.html: This is useful for tracking the move process, especially when dealing with many files.

content.code_html:
mv -v my_file.txt myfolder/new_directory/  
renamed 'my_file.txt' -> 'myfolder/new_directory/my_file.txt'

content.text: Using mv with Wildcards
Wildcards allow you to move multiple files at once. For example, mv *.txt /destination/ will move all text files to the destination folder.
content.html: Wildcards allow you to move multiple files at once. For example, mv *.txt /destination/ will move all text files to the destination folder.

content.code_html: mv *.txt /destination/
